meanings.definition: A person who works as a laborer or manual worker.
meanings.sent1: The bushelers unloaded the heavy crates from the truck.
meanings.sent2: The farm hired bushelers to harvest the crops.
meanings.sent3: The bushelers joked about their sore muscles after a long day's work.
meanings.sent4: The team of bushelers moved in perfect unison, like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The image of the bushelers toiling under the scorching sun stayed with him.

meanings.definition: A group of people who work together to accomplish a task.
meanings.sent1: The bushelers collaborated effectively to finish the project ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent2: The dedicated bushelers worked tirelessly to reach their common goal.
meanings.sent3: The bushelers celebrated their successful teamwork with a pizza party.
meanings.sent4: The bushelers resembled a close-knit family, always supporting each other.
meanings.sent5: The unity among the bushelers was truly inspiring to witness.

meanings.sent1: She bushelers through the night to complete the assignment.
meanings.sent2: The students bushelers on their group project with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent3: He bushelers with such passion that his colleagues were motivated to do the same.
meanings.sent4: The chef bushelers in the kitchen, creating culinary masterpieces.
meanings.sent5: The athletes bushelers on the field, giving their all in every game.
